headline: Awesome Pasta Salad
description: This pasta salad with pepperoni, salami, provolone, bell pepper, olives, and Italian dressing is easy to make ahead for summer picnics or potlucks.

video.description: Watch how to make a pasta salad filled with lots of good stuff.
video.name: Awesome Pasta Salad

name: Awesome Pasta Salad
recipeIngredient: 0.25 pound sliced pepperoni, cut in half
1 large green bell pepper, cut into 1 inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook fusilli in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain.
Combine fusilli with tomatoes, cheese, salami, pepperoni, green pepper, olives, and pimentos in a large bowl. Pour in salad dressing; toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: I make this salad often. It is very easy to customize to your own tastes. I add green olives and diced red onions. For pepperoni, I buy the bags of mini pepperoni. Great recipe for a party or picnic. Makes a lot of salad.
awesome

This is my new favorite pasta salad! I did not have fusilli pasta. Instead, I used large bow-tie pasta and the noodles held up well and looked beautiful. The salami and pepperoni make it for me! I had the deli employee cut the salami and pepperoni as thick as possible and cubed it up myself. I like the thick cubes of pepperoni versus the thin, round slices. I also added a cucumber (dried well before adding) and mild pepperochini. I liked the added color. I did dry the noodles very well and added Good Seasons Italian dressing (that you mix up. Instead of adding plain vinegar to the mix, I use red wine vinegar.) I made it all the night before and in the morning I mixed it up. I know that some said they added another 8 oz of dressing in the morning, but I do not like my pasta salad drenched and felt that all of the other ingredients really shined with 8 oz of dressing called for in the recipe. Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe!
It was just ok. Too much meat and definitely not enough Veggies. Wouldn't make again.

Made this for Memorial Day bbq and my kids absolutely loved it, which is high grade since they are picky eaters. I made it early in the morning, 7am, and served it chilled in the evening, 5pm. We stored the left over in the refrigerator and had it for lunch the next day.

I've been making something very similar to this for many years. For the pepperoni, the packaged stuff is very greasy! Go to the deli counter and ask for the sandwich style pepperoni. Ask them to cut off a chunk for about as much as you'll need and dice it yourself. It will taste much better. For those who say the pasta was too dry, you must remember that it acts like a sponge. Make the salad and check on it a few hours later to see if it needs more dressing or not. I sometimes add some pickle juice, pepperoncini juice, etc. to the pasta add let it absorb into the pasta before adding the pasta to the salad. It gives it a nice flavor.
This is a remarkable recipe. It was delicious!

I didn't have all the ingredients and needed a pasta salad for that evening, so I left out the cheese, salami and pepperoni. It was still amazing because it was a side salad to the meal. I will be sure to have all the ingredients next time I make this.
I swapped the cheese for feta and added sundried tomatoes!
This was so simple to make and it’s delicious!!

This is one of my favorite pasta salads that I make. I do make some minor changes as I love added extra veggies and take out the pimentos as I really don't like them. Whenever I make this one there are never leftovers.

I've made this several times for company dinners, family reunions, for a sick relative, and for home. It's been a big hit everytime. My grandson loved it and said I could make it for him anytime! I used the aged provolone cheese and it was so good in this salad. Will definitely continue to make it.
I use cheese tortellini in mine instead of the pasta
Delicious and easy. I made this for a pot luck and it was devoured. I added the black olives after this photo. I will surely make this again.
I didn't really like this, it was too much meat and cheese for me.
I switched to mozzarella & pepper jack cheese, green olives and just a lil more Italian dressing and it’s a holiday party favorite!!
You can add almost anything to this salad, but it is perfect as written.

I added a small jar of drained artichoke hearts, some green olives, a little red onion, and only salami, no pepperoni. I also used half the Provolone and more of the mozzarella, and used Kraft Zesty Italian to taste. I found a GF rotini pasta and now it's the most requested side dish for my GF friends
The only change I made was veggies - I used red peppers and frozen peas. Since there’s no mayo the pasta salad lasted for a week.

I used mozzarella instead of provolone and 16oz of dressing...
Perfect
I’m not much of a side dish maker, so I stretched myself with finding something for a family summer event. This salad was a hit- super impressed!
I didn't make any changes. It was delicious, and I'll be making it again!
Great pasta salad for a crowd. Next time I’ll make half the recipe. Great combination of veggies and protein. I would definitely make this again but substitute ham for the salami.
This is the best pasta salad recipe I have ever made! Everybody asks me to make it now at all our family gatherings. Thanks for giving us such an amazing recipe!
If you like a lil Zip add Pinapple chunks!!! I promise you’ll thank me
I never make changes to a recipe. I figure someone worked really hard creating it so I stay the course. If I don’t like it I won’t make it again.
Totally like it!
This was very good, and very easy to prepare. Thank you for sharing the recipe!!!
The cubes of provolone were a bit much.
Very tasty! I’ll definitely make this again.
Most delicious. I did substitute the green pepper with pepperoncicni. Everything else was as in the recipe. Try it you will love it, better than anything found in the deli section of the store. WOW!
Seemed somewhat bland.

I was the best pasta salad i'be ever done. I doubled the quantity for church Christmas party, and it was nothing left in this huge bowl only 1 hour after the party began.
Thank you so much, and looking forward to do, excitingly, other recipes :)
Absolutely the Best !!!
This has become my "go to" recipe anytime I've taking a side dish to a beach party or out on the boat during the summer.
Recipe was good. I did add cubed cheddar cheese. Seemed like it need more spices added to the recipe so add what tastes good to you.

I received a lot of compliments on the salad. I added pepperoni, cherry tomatoes, chopped red onion and cubes of cheddar cheese. I found the Wishbone Italian Robusto dressing and put about 8 oz on which seemed to be more that enough. It provided a nice flavor without being drenched in oil. I'll definitely make this again.

I've made this pasta salad several times now and I really like it. I've used different cheeses and different mixes of veggies depending on who I'm making it for. I've sometimes made it ahead for the next day and when I do that I always have some extra dressing to add before serving just in case it seems dry, and I also add the tomatoes and softer cheeses at that time so they don't get mushy. I also take the advice of other reviewers and dry the pasta before putting it in the bowl.
Very good cold pasta salad. I like the added veges to it.

This is always a hit with my family. I like to use the Kalamata Olives, so I use them for myself. My mother likes regular black olives and mozzarella cheese, so I sub that for the feta. I have made this several times...always good!
I made it exactly as recipe said. I thought it was a little bland. Next time I will add some onion and a little garlic. It is a good start to a recipe with possibilities. It just needs more flavor.

very simple and fresh. i added two kinds of salami and used yellow orange red and green bell peppers. did not use the italian dressing...made my own with high quality olive oil. ....also grated fresh reg over the top!
Made this for a gathering, this is the pan which was full- after 1/2 hr. I used Wishbone Italian. Crowd pleaser! I did t have pimentos and added a couple extra veggies we had in the fridge.

Excellent. I used cubed ham instead of the sliced pepperoni, but other than that made it to the recipe. I did end up using a full 16oz. bottle of Italian dressing (I used Newman's Own Home Style.)

This recipe makes a big bowl of pasta salad! I ate it both as a side dish and as a lunch - it was great. I added a small drizzle of additional dressing to the salad as needed after it was in the refrigerator for a few days.

Will definitely make again.

I made mine with salami, pepperoni, black olives, green onion, mozzarella balls, cherry tomatoes and Newman’s Italian dressing. I added more Italian herbs, ground oregano, basil, and salt. Delicious??
Yummy

The only change I made was using green and yellow peppers, shredding the cheese instead of cubing it and using half Olive Garden dressing/half Kraft Zesty Italian. I want to eat this every day of my life!
I changed all pork into beef selections. Pretty tasty
hard to miss with this one; used what I had which was mozzarella. Everything else perfect! Next time I'll add some red onions to boot.

I agree with everyone....this is a great side dish! I took it to an HOA BBQ last weekend and it got rave reviews! As many have done, I took liberties with the added ingredients, but what I kept in place was the rotini pasta and robust Italian dressing. Scrumptious!
I LOVED this recipe. Easy to follow and delicious! My entire family ate it up.

Simply DELICIOUS. Can alter ingredients with little to no concern for a negative impact. We started with a light Zesty Italian dressing but found it lacking so finished off with Olive Garden Italian Dressing...MUCH better. Black olives, green olives, ham, pepperoni, hard salami, red pepper, mozzarella cheese and pepper-jack cheese in ours and onion. Will DEFINITELY make again and maybe add banana peppers.
Just made it for first time. But just my nature to tweak any recipe. I added 1.5 tsp of Italian seasoning. Turned out great!
My favorite and well liked at neighborhood picnics.
Good summertime pasta. Best to cut pepperoni/or used cubed pepperoni as sliced tends to stick together.
We love this pasta salad recipe, the only change we made is to skip the pimentos, I don't like them.
I make this recipe every time I bbq and there's never any leftover!
Very Good
SO yummy. It's a whole meal in itself. I added lots of baby spinach and chick peas. Its a keeper.
The whole family absolutely loves this! We add some red onion.
This was delicious. When I make it again, I may sub a softer cheese, Colby jack. But other than that, 5 stars. Super easy and delish!
Double the dressing and double the cheese 1/2 pepperjack 1/2 colby. My family loves it... "the best pasta salad, ever!"

Excellent recipe. We are remodeling our house and staying in our travel trailer, so I needed an easy/no bake recipe for a Senior Citizen's lunch my son's 4-H group is hosting. This was perfect! The only disappointment was not getting to have it all to myself!
Did not make any changes & OMG everyone loved it
Made it twice already, following the recipe exactly. Loved it and will continue to make it, no changes.
I tried 4 grocery stores and couldn't find fusilli pasta anywhere. I used Rotini instead. I haven't tried it yet, but taking it to a family reunion tomorrow. Crossing my fingers!

Great pasta salad. Made tonight for tomorrow's gathering. Gave hubby a taste, and he asked for a bowl. Omitted the black olives 'cause we don't like, but added all the peppers we had on hand. Red, green, yellow and orange. YUMMY!
Omgoodness!!!!! So yummy. Our Church is having a grilled hamburger/hotdog luncheon on this Sunday. This will work perfect

As usual almost all recipes from AllRecipes.com are amazing!! This is no exception.
I have been making this for a long time . It gets a lot of raves. 
Thank you AllRecipes.com!! Keep them coming!! Nana
I've made it a bunch of times. I add what I have fresh in the fridge at the moment. It's always great ! Black olives, salad olives, no green peppers though, too strong, love it.

I read all the comments when I make a recipe and adjust accordingly. I followed the directions with these changes: added more dressing. I applied once to the noodles after they were cooked and then again when I mixed the salad. I used Italian dressing mixed with a Balsamic garlic dressing. I added some zucchini and parmesan cheese too. I brought the salad to a family dinner and it was a hit! Everyone took some home afterwards too because I made a double recipe. My husband, who does not like cold salads, even ate two helpings. :)
It's on my KEEPER list!!!
Good but the dressing drowns out the meat and cheese. For the health benefit, I would go with another recipe.

Use the pasta and Italian dressing as a jump off point for creativity. Have used kalamata and green olives, mozzarella pearls, pepperoncini, marinated mushrooms, marinated artichoke hearts, cucumbers, garbanzo beans, mini pepperoni's, hard salami. So many different options if you like strong flavors.

I have been making this salad for years and it is my go-to for potluck dinners. Mine is a little different ingredients almost every time I make it. What is in it depends on what I have for fresh veggies in the fridge. And instead of meat, I use shrimp and/or imitation crab. I use whole grain rotini for the pasta, and the beautiful color comes from the bright vegetables. Just a few colorful vegetables that I use are sliced green onions tops and all , cucumbers, broccoli, green peas( use frozen and no need to cook them), all colors of bell peppers....green red, yellow and orange, red onion, diced, zucchini squash, salad tomatoes, celery,. I have used several different dressings...Italian, Ranch, Vidalia onion. and have even used ranch mixed with a little Roka (roquefort cheese). I always add more dressing before serving as the pasta absorbs a lot of the dressing. I never bring home any leftovers from potluck.
The Italian salad dressing didn't not go well with it, the flavors didn't blend well.. it needs something else.

I have been making this for years and have used different kinds of pasta to change it up. Tri color bowties and spagetti also make this a wonderful pasta salad. My recipe also calls for half of a jar of salad seasoning. It is the McCormick Perfect Pinch brand. This gives it so much more flavor!
Needed to add ground black pepper and a little Italian Herbs
Looks delicious
Just a basic pasta salad, nothing special, its been done by anyone who has ever made a pasta salad

When I saw the name of this recipe I was excited that it might mean a good recipe for pasta salad dressing. Bottled Italian dressing is a pretty subjective thing and a lot could go wrong there. As many of the commenters say, there are a variety of ingredient combinations that make for a good pasta salad. That said, I did make the recipe just as stated and with Kraft lite Italian dressing. The meat addition is new for me and was nice. All good but I am still looking for a great scratch dressing for pasta salad.

Yes, I used the Ruffles Garden Vegetable pasta, chopped onions, diced dill pickles and Newman's Own Garlic Parmesan Dressing. So very delicious and a family favorite. So easy to make and a definite crowd pleaser.

Lose the lunch meats, it's PASTA salad! I use Robusto Italian dressing and it's too bland unless you use 1/2 container Salad Supreme seasoning. I add green pepper, black olives, onion and grape tomatoes. Always a hit!

When I make a pasta salad, I like to keep it as healthy as possible with lots of fresh veggies and not a ton of dressing. I can't imagine a pasta salad with salami and pepperoni - all that fat and salt! This just sounds very unappealing.

This is a great recipe we have had it every Friday since early May... we use our homemade deer summer sausage and it comes out great. It makes a great light meal perfect for relaxing after a long week.

I make this without the green pepper and add extra Italian Dressing. 
Best to let it sit in the fridge for a couple hours to let all the flavors blend.
This was great I took every ingredient and exchanged it with something else. Wound up with a fabulous chocolate cake!
Awesome, just like the recipe says!
I love this pasta salad recipe. It always makes a large amount and compliments burgers at a summer BBQ perfectly.
Made it for a picnic and every one loved it. Thought it was store bought. So easy and so good. Going to try some of the other suggestions next time around, though I think it is perfect the way it is.
added onions, & catalina dressing. Yum! Yes, will make again.

It's delicious!! I made it with Olive Garden Italian and one dry pack of Italian seasoning dressing as suggested. Green Olives instead of black and added 1 cup of baby carrots for added color and variety. The good thing about this salad is you can choose what you want to add or change. But the secret ingredient is the Italian seasoned dressing, perfect!
Great pasta salad. I didn't change a thing.
Great salad, easy to make. I substituted some, but it was very good.
My wife made this and it's delicious!! She made another one to take to a party and several people wanted the redipe.

I knew better but I followed the directions and used bottle dressing and after tasting it I wished I hadn't. I find bottle dressings bland and only used them sparingly. I will make this pasta salad again but next time use my own dressing.
made this for July 1st party it was a big it will be making it again and again
Excellent make ahead side dish, my Italian family loved it !

Fantastic recipe! We omitted the jar of pimentos. We used sea shells as the pasta, and added a sliced, quartered cucumber. We made it the night before the party, and the day of added more dressing. We used more than 16 oz of Italian dressing. Everyone enjoyed this pasta salad.
